COMMUNITY ANNOUNCEMENT:
CCSD is seeking Substitute Registered Nurses. Please see the information below:

Substitute School Nurses

Job Description:

Corinth CSD is seeking Substitute School Nurses for all buildings. Applicant must be NYS Certified as a Registered Professional Nurse.
Possible Daily Job Duties:

Provide supervision of sick or injured pupils until they are placed under the care of their parents or legal guardians.

Secure medical care for students in emergency cases if parents/guardians or emergency contacts cannot be reached.

Administers internal medicine under written doctor's orders and written parental permission during the school day.

Records pupil visits to the Health Office, including but not limited to filing accident/incident reports as required.

Carries out other duties as assigned.

Please apply on OLAS or send a cover letter and resume to Corinth CSD, 105 Oak street, Corinth NY 12822.

Just a reminder: Tomorrow is the drive-thru food pantry beginning at 11 a.m. at Corinth Elementary School.

From our district website:

On Thursday, April 30 at 11 a.m., the Regional Food Bank of Northeastern NY will sponsor a drive-thru Food Pantry at the Corinth Elementary School for all families in need. A drive-thru pantry is a safe way to provide food to households struggling to access sufficient amounts of healthy foods during the pandemic.

“This effort complements the wonderful work already being done through food pantries and the School Food Service feeding efforts,” says Susan Lintner from the Regional Food Bank.

This no-contact, no-cost, food distribution event was set up to provide residents with an additional opportunity to receive fresh produce, dairy, and frozen meats along with non-perishable items. Much like the free milk program, we ask that families stay in their vehicles and someone will bring a bag to the vehicle.

Stewart’s Shops supports Corinth families in need!

Stewart's Shops have a long history of supporting the people and businesses in the communities they serve, both in good times and in bad. So it’s really no surprise that when Corinth Superintendent Dr. Mark Stratton reached out to the Stewart’s Shops Corporate Office in Malta, they took immediate action. Dr. Stratton explained that the milk cartons included with the meals provided through the district's Food Service Program are not enough for some of the district’s neediest families. Within days, Dr. Stratton received FREE gift certificates for gallons of milk, which will be distributed to families in need in the coming weeks.

Thank you, Stewart's Shops, for being valued community partners with Corinth Central School District year round, especially during this challenging time.

Corinth Central School is proud to announce that we have 3 Scholar-Athlete winter sports teams: Varsity Wrestling, Girls Varsity Basketball and Varsity Cheerleading!

The New York State Public High School Athletic Association recognizes teams who have at least 75% of their roster with a 90% or higher Grade Point Average.

We are proud to have student athletes who excel in the classroom and on the court, keeping academics as their priority while honoring their commitment to athletics.

Congratulations to all on a great season and much success in the classroom.
Keep up the excellent effort as you serve as role models for all of our students.

We wish much success to our spring sports teams and hope to be honoring their academic and athletic success in the future.

Congratulations, Tomahawks!!

Corinth Tomahawks Wrestling Page
February 29 at 11:14 PM ·

Final update from the NYS Championships:
First a little perspective. There were over 10,000 student athletes competing in the sport of wrestling this year. Only 5% make it to the state championship tournament. Or, put another way, the competitors are among the top 16 athletes in their weight class in the entire state of New York.￼￼￼ It takes a lot of hard work, dedication, perseverance, blood, sweat and tears to get there.￼ So, kudos to our two competitors- Johnathan Freebern and Alec Richards.
John ended up going 1-2, losing only to the third place and eighth place wrestlers in a highly competitive weight class. ￼￼
Alec went 4-2 and took fifth place! His only losses were to the state champ and the third place wrestler. What a great tournament for these two athletes. And what a great year for the whole Tomahawk team!

Our Business Law students recently had a hands-on field trip experience to enhance their studies. They visited the Saratoga County Court.

Students were given a full tour of the various courts by Assistant District Attorney, Gordon Eddy. He spoke about the role of the grand jury, courts of jurisdiction and various career opportunities within the court system. Mr. Eddy also serves as a volunteer Mock Trial Attorney Coach for the CHS team.

Criminal County Court Judge, James Murphy III, invited students to observe his criminal matters before the court. Later, he debriefed with the students. He also shared the importance of internships and networking in their future career endeavors.

Judge Matthew Coseo also spoke to students about the role of probate in Surrogate Court.

Our CHS students were fortunate to have this real world experience with these esteemed legal professionals, fostering community partnerships with CCSD.

Post contribution: HS Social Media/Digital Communication student, Harley Wells
Photos courtesy of D. Fay (Thank you!)
